title: Clorox Wins 2023 EPA Award for Advancing Green Chemistry - PR Newswire
summary: The Clorox Company won the EPA Green Chemistry Award for its Clorox EcoClean™ Disinfecting Cleaner made with a plant-based ingredient, aligning with its sustainability goals and commitment to environmental responsibility.
green_innovation: TRUE - The Clorox Company's development and launch of Clorox EcoClean™ Disinfecting Cleaner with a plant-based active ingredient align with green innovation by reducing the use of hazardous substances and promoting sustainability.
business_innovation: FALSE - The article focuses on a product innovation (Clorox EcoClean™ Disinfecting Cleaner) rather than a new business process.
green_product: TRUE - The Clorox EcoClean™ Disinfecting Cleaner is designed to significantly reduce its environmental impact through the use of plant-based ingredients and sustainable production processes.
green_process: TRUE - The development of the Clorox EcoClean™ Disinfecting Cleaner using a plant-based active ingredient showcases a green process that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325611 - Soap and Other Detergent Manufacturing, 325612 - Polish and Other Sanitation Good Manufacturing, 325613 - Surface Active Agent Manufacturing, 424690 - Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE - The article highlights genuine efforts by The Clorox Company to develop environmentally responsible products, demonstrating a commitment to sustainability rather than greenwashing.

title: Innovations from Cosmetic 360's 2023 edition - BW Confidential
summary: The article discusses various green innovations showcased at the Cosmetic 360 event in Paris, including eco-conscious brands, clean energy technologies, sustainable packaging, and traceability solutions.
green_innovation: TRUE, The article describes innovations focused on clean technologies, sustainable practices, and biodiverse sourcing, all contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: FALSE, The article primarily focuses on green innovations in the beauty industry rather than new business processes or products in a broader economic context.
green_product: TRUE, Several products mentioned, such as compostable packaging, zero waste solutions, and eco-designed skincare, aim to reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycles.
green_process: TRUE, The article describes processes promoting environmental sustainability, such as using clean energy, decarbonization efforts, and reducing waste.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325620 - Toilet Preparation Manufacturing, 325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing, 325410 - Pharmaceutical and Medicine Manufacturing, 339999 - All Other Miscellaneous Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE, The article presents genuine innovations in green practices and products without any indication of greenwashing tactics.

title: Coffee biorefinery opened in Denmark to upcycle coffee grounds - FoodNavigator.com
summary: Kaffe Bueno's biorefinery upcycles coffee grounds into food and cosmetic products, preventing emissions and reducing environmental impact.
green_innovation: TRUE, the biorefinery is transforming wasted coffee grounds into useful products, promoting sustainability, and reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE, the establishment of the biorefinery and the development of new products from upcycled coffee grounds represent a significant new business process for Kaffe Bueno.
green_product: TRUE, the products created by upcycling coffee grounds fit the definition of green products by significantly reducing environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, the use of green chemistry and biotechnology in the biorefinery processes minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325199 - All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing, 311920 - Coffee and Tea Manufacturing, 311352 - Confectionery Manufacturing from Purchased Chocolate, and 325414 - Biological Product (except Diagnostic) Manufacturing

title: CPHI Barcelona 2023 - Event preview - European Pharmaceutical Review
summary: CPHI Barcelona is set to take place covering a range of topics like biomanufacturing, formulation, and sustainability. The event provides a platform for global pharma connections and partnerships. It introduces new features including The Start-Up Market and focuses on sustainability and social responsibility. The agenda includes sessions on innovation, sustainability, and future therapies.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article mentions efforts to reduce environmental impact, promote sustainability, and celebrate sustainability initiatives, aligning with the concept of green innovation.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses new features like The Start-Up Market, which introduces innovative products and solutions and promotes networking and partnerships, qualifying as business innovation.
green_product: FALSE. While the article discusses efforts towards sustainability in the pharma industry, it does not focus on a specific product design, manufacturing, or usage that significantly reduces environmental impact, which is necessary to qualify as a green product.
green_process: TRUE. The article mentions efforts towards sustainable practices in the pharma industry, including reducing environmental impact through initiatives like sustainable transportation, renewable energy usage, and minimizing single-use stands, meeting the criteria for a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 541714 - Research and Development in Biotechnology, 325412 - Pharmaceutical Preparation Manufacturing, 541711 - Research and Development in Biotechnology, and 325413 - In-Vitro Diagnostic Substance Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not display characteristics of greenwashing as it highlights genuine efforts towards sustainability, responsible event organizing, and celebrating sustainability initiatives within the pharma industry.

title: Top pharma companies 2023: A satisfactory year - PharmaLive
summary: Top pharmaceutical companies are focusing on new innovations beyond COVID-19, including acquisitions and partnerships. Efforts are underway to address challenges such as patent expirations and pricing regulations in the US. Companies like Novo Nordisk, Amgen, Pfizer, Eli Lilly, and Sanofi are engaged in strategic acquisitions to enhance their product portfolios.
green_innovation: FALSE - The text primarily focuses on pharmaceutical companies engaging in acquisitions and partnerships to enhance their product portfolios. It does not center on innovations aimed at environmental sustainability or reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE - The article mentions pharmaceutical companies seeking new innovations beyond COVID-19, engaging in acquisitions and partnerships to introduce new products and processes, which aligns with the definition of business innovation.
green_product: FALSE - While the article discusses the pharmaceutical products offered by various companies, it does not delve into the environmental impact or sustainability features of these products, thus not meeting the criteria of a green product.
green_process: FALSE - The article does not detail any specific methods or techniques in manufacturing, production, or operational activities that focus on minimizing environmental impacts or promoting sustainability. As a result, it does not describe a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325412 (Pharmaceutical Preparation Manufacturing), 541715 (Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences), 621511 (Medical Laboratories), 325411 (Medicinal and Botanical Manufacturing)
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not exhibit characteristics of greenwashing, as it primarily discusses the strategic moves and innovations of pharmaceutical companies, without making false or misleading environmental claims.
